meanings.sent1: His paunch jiggled as he laughed heartily.
meanings.sent2: The man's paunch made it difficult for him to bend over.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to snuggle on the paunch of the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky resembled a giant paunch hanging over the city.
meanings.sent5: The chef's paunch was a testament to his love for rich food.

meanings.definition: To have a large and protruding belly.
meanings.sent1: After years of indulging, he began to paunch out.
meanings.sent2: She noticed her father starting to paunch out after retirement.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to paunch out as it filled with air.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to paunch out as it widened around the bend.
meanings.sent5: The pastry dough began to paunch out as it rose in the oven.
